channel.title: Erin's Audio Corner
channel.description: Recent content on Erin's Audio Corner

item.description: Information Note: These speakers are designed specifically for car audio use and come with a kit of mounting gear such as adapter rings, grilles and additional installation hardware.

item.title: Dyn Audio MW182 10-Inch Woofer Review

item.title: Jamo S807 Floorstanding Speaker Review
item.description: YouTube Video Review version: Intro First off, I’ll just save you a lot of trouble if you’re a casual reader or someone wanting to know if they should buy these speakers for budget friendly hi-fi stereo use: Do not buy these speakers.

item.title: Buchardt Audio S400 Bookshelf Speaker Review
item.description: YouTube Video Review version: Intro: A few months ago, I came across a forum post that touched on Buchardt Audio’s S400 bookshelf speaker.

item.title: MiniDSP C-DSP 8x12 with Dirac Live Review
item.description: Foreword: Up for review is the MiniDSP C-DSP 8x12 with Dirac Live. This can be purchased directly from miniDSP.

item.title: Tectonic Elements TEBM35C10-4 Miniature BMR® Driver Review
item.description: A few years back… I was browsing the Parts-Express website and came upon some products from Tectonic Elements that I thought were interesting: the BMR series speakers.

item.title: Audiofrog GB15 1.5 inch Dome Tweeter
item.description: IntroIt’s worth noting this review is based on mostly objective data. These drivers – as well as the others from the AudioFrog GB series speakers – include a LOT of installation hardware to make installs quicker and easier.

item.title: Audiofrog GB25 2.5 inch Midrange
item.description: Up for test is AudioFrog’s GB25 2.5 inch Midrange. Pictures don’t do justice to the smallness of these drivers but here they are anyway…

item.title: Hyrbrid Audio Technologies L1-Pro-R2 Ring Radiator Driver Review
item.description: Up for test is the Hybrid Audio L1 Pro R2 Ring Radiator Tweeter. Information from the manufacturer can be found here: http://store.

item.title: ScanSpeak Revelator 12M/4631-G00 4.5″ Midrange Driver Review
item.description: Up for test is the venerable Scan-Speak Revelator 12M/4631G-00 4.5″ Midrange. Some refer to this as one of (if not the) best pure midrange available.

item.title: Gladen Aerospace 20 Tweeter Review
item.description: Up for test is the Gladen Aerospace 20mm tweeter. Product specs can be found here.

item.title: Gladen Aerospace 28 Tweeter Review
item.description: Up for test is the Gladen Aerospace 28mm tweeter. Product specs can be found here.

item.title: JL Audio ZR800-CW 8″ Midbass Review
item.description: Note: While this driver is no longer made, however, to this day I still think it’s one of the best pure midbass drivers ever produced.

item.title: Scan-Speak Illuminator D3004/602000 Tweeter
item.description: Up for test is the Scan-Speak Illuminator D3004/6020-00 1″ Textile Dome Tweeter 4 ohm.

item.title: Audiofrog GB40 4 inch Midrange
item.description: Up for test is AudioFrog’s GB40 4″ Midrange. These drivers – as well as the others from the AudioFrog GB series speakers – include a LOT of installation hardware to make installs quicker and easier.

item.title: Scanspeak 10F/8414G10 Discovery 4 inch Fullrange
item.description: Up for test is Scan’s newer edition to their 10F lineage: The 10F/8414G10. This features a smaller neo magnet than it’s predecessors (like the 10F 4-ohm midrange tested here), making it an easier fit for tighter install applications.

item.title: SB Acoustics Satori MW13P-4 5 inch Mid
item.description: Up for test is SB Acoustics’ Satori MW13P-4 5″ Midwoofer/midrange. At the time of this updated-posting (02/16/2020) this driver can be purchased from Madisound for about $131/each.

item.title: Kef LS50 Speaker Drive Unit Testing
item.description: Up for test is the raw drive unit from Kef’s flagship LS50 monitor. This bookshelf speaker set has gotten a whole lot of praise over the years and as of this writing (02/03/2020) is currently priced at $899 on Amazon (affiliate link here), if you feel so inclined to purchase them.

item.title: Rythmik Audio F12G Direct Servo Subwoofer In-Depth Review
item.description: Foreword: Rather than discuss only the performance of the enclosed subwoofer, I want to present some more, detailed information that not even some manufacturers are able to obtain.

item.title: Kef R300 Speaker Drive Unit Testing
item.description: By now you’ve probably seen my testing of the Kef Q100 drive unit. I had read the next step in the Kef Uni-Q line are the drivers in the “R” series.

item.title: Bohlender Graebener Neo10 Planar Transducer
item.description: *Update 02/2020: The results of this driver’s measured performance and unit-to-unit consistency have caught me a lot of grief as of late.

item.title: Scanspeak 10F/4424G00 Discovery 4 inch Midrange (4 ohm version)
item.description: Up for test is the Scanspeak Discovery 10F/4424G 4 inch, 4 ohm midrange. This driver features a neo magnet to keep its weight down.

item.title: Kef Q100 Speaker Drive Unit Testing
item.description: As with the Kef HTS3001SE I tested, I ordered a set of the Kef Q100 Bookshelf speakers in order to remove and review the raw Q100 driver itself.

item.title: Fountek FR88EX Fullrange
item.description: Another popular choice for fullrange use, the Fountek FR88EX (PE Affiliate Link here) is tested and results provided below.

item.title: Fountek FR89EX Fullrange
item.description: Another popular choice for fullrange use, the Fountek FR89EX (PE Affiliate Link here) is tested and results provided below.

item.title: Seas H1397-04 (27TAFNC/D) 1 inch Aluminum Dome Tweeter
item.description: Up for test is the SEAS Prestige H1397 1” Aluminum Dome Tweeter. A commonly used tweeter in the car audio world and home audio world due to its compact size (outer diameter is only 53mm; approximately 2 inches) and relatively low cost.

item.title: Aurasound NS3-193-8A1 3 inch Fullrange
item.description: I’ve seen the Aurasound NS3 drivers discussed frequently as a great little driver to use in small spaces, with all sorts of potential uses.

item.title: JL Audio C5-400cm 4-inch Midrange Review
item.description: Up for test is a JL Audio C5-400cm midrange. I was interested in this driver as it seems to be of reasonable cost given the small form factor and mounting options in addition to the fact that it uses a Kurt Müller cone design, which is a well regarded cone manufacturer.

item.title: ScanSpeak Illuminator 12MU/4731T-00
item.description: Up for test is the Scanspeak Illuminator 12MU/4731T-00 4.5” Midrange - 4 ohm. Note: For a while I didn’t have the means to measure frequency response accurately.

item.title: Seas W18NX-001
item.description: Up for test is a Seas W18NX-001. This is another driver that will be party of Jerry Niebur’s Midwoofer Subjective Shootout next month.
Click here to email me Click here to join my Facebook Group
This site is funded with my own money but is improved on with support from the community.
Test Methods: I took a hiatus from testing for a couple years and therefore my test setup has changed.
